ржЖржзрзБржирж┐ржХ рж╢рж┐ржХрзНрж╖рж╛ржмрзНржпрж╛ржмрж╕рзНржерж╛ ржмрж┐ржирж╛ ржЦрж░ржЪрзЗ рж╕ржХрж▓рзЗрж░ рж╣рж╛рждрзЗ ржкрзМржЫрзЗ ржжрзЗржмрж╛рж░ ржкрзНрж░рждрж┐рж╢рзНрж░рзБрждрж┐ ржирж┐рзЯрзЗ ржжрзНрж░рзБржд ржЖрж╕ржЫрж┐ рж╣рж╛рждрзЗрж░ ржорзБржарзЛрзЯ

ржЪрзЛржЦ рж░рж╛ржЦрзБржи: рзирзм ржбрж┐рж╕рзЗржорзНржмрж░ рзирзжрзирзи ЁЯЗзЁЯЗй ржУрзЯрзЗржмрж╕рж╛ржЗржЯрзЗ!

ржмрж┐ржирж╛ ржорзБрж▓рзНржпрзЗ ржЧржгрж┐ржд? ржХрж┐ржирзНрждрзБ ржХрзЗржи?

ржЧржирж┐рждрзЗрж░ ржоржд ржПржХржЯрж┐ ржорзМрж▓рж┐ржХ ржмрж┐ржЬрзНржЮрж╛ржи ржмрж┐ржирж╛ ржорзБрж▓рзНржпрзЗ ржХрзЗ ржмрж╛ рж╢рж┐ржЦрж╛ржмрзЗ? ржХрзЗржиржЗ ржмрж╛ рж╢рж┐ржЦрж╛ржмрзЗ? ржПрж╕ржХрж▓ ржкрзНрж░рж╢рзНржирзЗрж░ ржЙрждрзНрждрж░ ржЦрзБржЬржЫрзЗржи?

рж╣рзНржпрж╛, ржЖржорж░рж╛ ржмрж┐ржирж╛ржорзБрж▓рзНржпрзЗ ржЧржирж┐рждрзАржХ рж╢рж┐ржХрзНрж╖рж╛ ржПржмржВ рж╕рж╣рж╛рзЯржХ ржмржЗ рж╢рж┐ржХрзНрж╖рж╛рж░рзНржерзАржжрзЗрж░ ржмрж┐ржирж╛ ржЦрж░ржЪрзЗ рж╕рж░ржмрж░рж╛рж╣ ржХрж░ржмред ржЖржоржжрзЗрж░ рж╕рзЗржмрж╛ ржкрзЗрждрзЗ ржПржХржЬржи рж╢рж┐ржХрзНрж╖рж╛рж░рзНржерзАрж░ ржХрзЗржмрж▓ ржЗржирзНржЯрж╛рж░ржирзЗржЯ ржХрж╛ржирзЗржХрж╢ржирзЗрж░ржЗ ржкрзНрж░рзЯрзЛржЬржи!

рж╕ржХрж▓ ржЧрж╛ржЗржб ржбрж╛ржЙржирж▓рзЛржб ржХрж░рзЗ ржкрзЬрж╛рж░ ржПржмржВ ржПржЗ рж╕рж╛ржЗржЯрзЗ рж╕ржорж╕рзНржпрж╛ ржЖрж▓рзЛржЪржирж╛ ржХрж░рж╛рж░ рж╕рзБржпрзЛржЧ рждрзЛ ржЖржЫрзЗржЗ!

рзмрж╖рзНржа ржерзЗржХрзЗ рззрзирж╢ рж╢рзНрж░рзЗржгрж┐рж░ рж╕ржХрж▓ рж╕ржорж╛ржзрж╛ржи ржерж╛ржХржЫрзЗ ржЖржорж╛ржжрзЗрж░ рж╕рж╛ржЗржЯрзЗред рждрж╛ржЫрж╛рзЬрж╛ржУ ржерж╛ржХржЫрзЗ ржмрж┐ рж╕рж┐ ржПрж╕ ржПржмржВ ржмрзНржпрж╛ржВржХ ржорзНржпрж╛рже рж╕ржорж╛ржзрж╛ржи!┬а

ржЖржорж░рж╛ рж╣рждрзЗ ржЪрж▓рзЗржЫрж┐ ржжрзЗрж╢рзЗрж░ ржкрзНрж░ржержо ржлрзНрж░рж┐ ржЕржирж▓рж╛ржЗржи ржорзНржпрж╛рже ржкрзНрж▓рзНржпрж╛ржЯржлрж░рзНржо!


ржЪрзЛржЦ рж░рж╛ржЦрзБржи рзирзмрж╢рзЗ ржбрж┐рж╕рзЗржорзНржмрж░ рзирзжрзирзиред

items.title: Numerical Problems BCS
items.summary: \documentclass[a4,32pt]{book} \begin{document} \chapter{Numerical Problems} The most emph{Important part }in solving numerical mathematical problems is \emph{Knowing When to use which formula!}.
items.content_html:
\documentclass[a4,32pt]{book}

egin{document}

\chapter{Numerical Problems}

The most emph{Important part }in solving numerical mathematical problems is \emph{Knowing When to use which formula!}. Here We will discuss some important day to day formula.
\section{Numerical Formula}
egin{itemize}
┬а ┬а \item $a^{2}-b^{2}=(a+b)(a-b)$
┬а ┬а \item $(a+b)^{2}=a^{2}+b^{2}+2ab$
┬а ┬а \item $(a-b)^{2}=a^{2}+b^{2}-2ab$
┬а ┬а \item $4ab=(a+b)^{2}(a-b)^{2}$
┬а ┬а \item $(a+b)^{3}=a^{3}+b^{3}+3a^{2}b+3ab^{2}$
┬а ┬а \item $(a+b)^{3}=a^{3}-b^{3}-3a^{2}b+3ab^{2}$
┬а ┬а \item $(a+b+c)^{2}=a^{2}+b^{2}+c^{2}+2(ab+bc+ca)$
\end{itemize}
This are the most used formula we will find in different problems. Make sure to memorize these formula. Now it's time to solve some problems.
\section{Digit Related Problems}
egin{itemize}
\item extbf{1. A, B, C, D, E are 5 consecutive numbers in increasing order, Deleting one from the set decreased the sum of the remaining numbers by 20\% of the sum of 5. Which one of the number is deleted from the set? }\emph{[BB(officer)-2015]}┬а
\end{itemize}
extbf{Solution:}
let the first number be $x$.
then the next four consecutive numbers are┬а
$x+1, x+2, x+3, x+4$.┬а
So, the sum of five numbers is=$5x+10$. ewline
if one number is decreased from the sum new sum is ewline
$(5x+10) imes20\%$ ewline
$=(5x+10) imes rac{20}{100} ewline$
$=(5x+10) imes rac{1}{5} ewline$
$=x+2$
ewline
We see that $x+2$ was our 3rd consecutive number. ewline We conclude that 3rd number that is extbf{C} was ┬аremoved from the set


egin{itemize}
┬а ┬а \item extbf{2. If the sum of 5 Consecutive Integers is M, What is the largest integer of the set in terms of M?} ┬а\emph{[BB(officer)-2015]} ewline extbf{Solution:}
\end{itemize}
egin{center}
┬а ┬а┬а
┬а ┬а Let the first Integer be x. Then the four following consecutive integers are $x+1$, $x+2$, $x+3$, $x+4$ ewline
┬а ┬а sum of the 5 integers is ewline
┬а ┬а $x+x+1+x+2+x+3+x+4=M ewline
┬а ┬а or,5x+10=M ewline or, 5x=M-10 ewline or,x= rac{M-10}{5}$ ewline
┬а ┬а We have our largest number $x+4$ that is ewline
┬а ┬а $x+4= rac{M-10}{5}+4 ewline
┬а ┬а or, x+4 = rac{M-10+20}{5} ewline
┬а ┬а or, x+4= rac{M+10}{5}
┬а ┬а $ ewline
┬а ┬а The largest Number $x+4$ interms of M is $ rac{M+10}{5}$
\end{center}
egin{itemize}
┬а ┬а \item extbf{3. An old man Distributed all his gold coins to his two sons into two different numbers such that the difference between the squares of the two numbers is 36 times the difference between the two numbers. How many coins did the old man had? } ewline\emph{[SIBL(TO CASH) 2013]}
┬а ┬а ewline extbf{Solution: ewline}
\end{itemize}

┬а ┬а Let us assume that the old man had $x$ ┬а$^*$ coins. first son had "a" ┬аcoins and second son had "b" coins. ewline So first son has "a" coins and second son has $b=x-a$ coins and $a+b=x$
┬а ┬а as the question suggests, ewline
┬а ┬а egin{center}
┬а ┬а $a^{2}-b^{2}=36(a-b) ewline┬а
┬а ┬а or, ┬а ┬а(a+b)(a-b)=36(a-b) ewline
┬а ┬а or, (a+b)=36$ ewline

\end{center} extbf{The old man had total 36 coins.}

{ enewcommand{ hefootnote}{ nsymbol{footnote}}
┬а ┬а \setcounter{footnote}{1}
┬а ┬а ootnotetext{\emph{[Assuming old man had x coins is pretty useless. But it is important for method learning.]} }
┬а ┬а \setcounter{footnote}{1}
}
%-------------------------------------------%
┬а egin{itemize}
┬а ┬а ┬а\item extbf{4. The difference between two numbers is 5 and the difference between their squares is 65. What is the largest number?} \emph{[BB(Oficer)-2015]}\end{itemize}┬а
┬а ┬а ┬а ┬а ┬а extbf{Solution:}
┬а ┬а ┬аlet the largest number be 'a' and the smallest number be 'b'. that is $a>b$ ewline
┬а ┬а ┬аGiven┬а
┬а ┬а ┬а ┬а ┬а$a-b=5\dotfill(4.1) ewline ewline a^{2}-b^{2}=65$\dotfill(4.2)
┬а ┬а ┬а
┬аWe know that ewline
┬а egin{center}
┬а ┬а ┬а$a^{2}-b^{2}=(a+b)(a-b) ewline
┬а ┬а ┬аor, 65=(a+b) imes5 ewline
┬а ┬а ┬аor, (a+b)= rac{65}{5} ewline
┬а ┬а ┬аor, (a+b)=13 ewline
┬а ┬а ┬а(a+b)\dotfill(4.3)$
┬а ┬а ┬а ewline ┬а\end{center}
┬а ┬а ┬аAdding (4.1) and (4.3) we obtain ewline
┬а ┬а ┬а$(a+b)+(a-b)=13+5
┬а ┬а ┬а ewline
┬а ┬а ┬а(a+b)+(a-b)=18 ewline
┬а ┬а ┬аor, 2a=18 ewline┬а
┬а ┬а ┬аor, a=9\dotfill(4.4)
┬а ┬а ┬а ewline $
┬а ┬а ┬аfrom equation (4.1) we have, ewline
┬а ┬а ┬а$
┬а ┬а ┬аa-b=5 ewline
┬а ┬а ┬аor, 9-b=5 ewline
┬а ┬а ┬аor, b=9-5 ewline or, b=4
┬а ┬а ┬а ewline
┬а ┬а ┬аb=4\dotfill(4.5)
┬а ┬а ┬а$ ewline
extbf{ ┬а ┬а the Largest number A is equal 9 and ewline the Smallest number B is equal 4}
%-------------------------------------------%
egin{itemize}
┬а ┬а \item extbf{5. The difference between a two digit number and the number obtained by interchanging the digits is 36. What is the difference between the sum and the difference of the digits of the number if the ratio between the digits of the number is $1:2$?}\emph{[PKB(JEO)-2014]}
┬а ┬а┬а
\end{itemize}
extbf{Solution:}
Let us assume the unit place digit be x and the Hundreth placed number is y. ewline Then the number is $10y+x$. ewline
After interchanging the digits we have ┬а$10x+y$ ewline
Given, ewline
┬а$(10y+x)-(10x+y)=36 ewline
or, 10y-y-10x+x=36 ewline
or, 9y-9x=36 ewline
or,9(y-x)=36 ewline
or, y-x=4\dotfill(5.1) ewline
$
and the ratio between x and y is 1:2 that is ewline
$ rac{x}{y}= rac{1}{2} ewline
$or,$ 2x=y\dotfill(5.2) ewline$
Inserting the value in equation (5.1) we obtain, ewline
$y-x=4 ewline
or, 2x-x=4 ewline
or,x=4 ewline$
and ewline
$y=2x ewline
or, y =2 imes4 ewline
or, y=8$

Now the sum of the digits $8+4=12$ ewline
The difference of the digits $8-4=4$ ewline
extbf{The Difference between the sum and the difference is 12-4=8}
%-------------------------------------------%
egin{itemize}
┬а ┬а \item ┬а extbf{6. A two digit number becomes five-sixth of itself when its digits are reversed. The two digits differ by one. What is the number? }\emph{[Please Notify Writer if you find reference.]}
\end{itemize}
extbf{Solution:}
ewline
we emphasise on the fact that "\emph{The two digits differ by one}" ewline
if one digit is x, the other digit is x+1(=y we assume.). ┬а ┬а ┬а ┬а ewline
The required number is 10y+x, as the number decreases when the digits are reversed. We are sure that the hundredth place on the number is y. ewline
Given, ┬а ┬а ┬а ┬а ewline
$(10x+y)= rac{5}{6} imes(10y+x) ┬а ┬а ewline ┬а ┬а
or , 6(10x+y) =5(10y+x) ewline
or , 60x+6y=50y+5x ewline
or, 55x=44y ewline
or, 55x=44(x+1) ewline
or,55x-44x=44 ewline
or,11x=44 ewline
or, x=4$
First digit is 4, then the second digit y=x+1=4+1=5. ┬а ┬а ewline
extbf{So, the number is 10y+x=10$ imes$5+4=54}

%-------------------------------------------%%-------------------------------------------%%-------------------------------------------%
egin{itemize}
┬а ┬а \item extbf{7. A number consists of two digits. The sum of the digit is 9. If 63 is subtracted from the number, its digits interchange. Find the number. }\emph{[notify writer if you find reference]}
\end{itemize}
extbf{Solution:} ewline
let the digits be a and b and the relation between a \& b be ewline
$a+b=9$ ewline
$a=9-b$\dotfill(7.1) ewline
let the number be $10a+b$
Given, ewline
$(10a+b)-63=10b+a$
or, $10a-a-63=10b-b$ ewline┬а
$or, 9a-9b=63 ewline$ ewline
$or, 9(a-b)=63 ewline $ ewline
$or, a-b=7 ewline $ ewline
$or, 9-b-b=7 ewline $ ewline
$or, 9-2b-7=0 ewline $ ewline
$or,9-7=2b ewline$ ewline
$or,b=1$ ewline
Using equation (7.1) we obtain, ewline
$a=9-b ewline
or, a=9-1 ewline
or, a=8$ ewline
extbf{The number is 10a+b=10$ imes$8+1=81}
%-------------------------------------------%%-------------------------------------------%%-------------------------------------------%
egin{itemize}
┬а ┬а \item extbf{8. If 5 is added to the sum of two digits of a number consisting of two digits, the sum will be three times the digits of ┬аthe tenth place. Moreover, If the place of the digits are interchanged, The number thus found will be 9 less than the original number. Find the number ewline }
┬а ┬а \emph{[DB(MTO)-2016, HBFCL(SO)-2015]}

┬а ┬а┬а
\end{itemize}
┬а ┬а extbf{ ewline Solution: ewline}
┬а ┬а let us suppose that the number is 10a+b. ewline
┬а ┬а Given, ewline
┬а ┬а $(a+b)+5=3a ewline
or, ┬а ┬а2a=b+5\dotfill (8.1) ewline
again, ewline
(10b+a)+9=10a+b ewline
or, 9b+9=9a ewline
or,b+1=a ewline
or, b+1= rac{b+5}{2} ewline
or, b+1= rac{b}{2}+ rac{5}{2} ewline
or,b- rac{b}{2}= rac{5}{2}-1 ewline
or, rac{b}{2}= rac{5-2}{2} ewline
or,b=2 imes rac{3}{2} ewline
or, b=3$ ewline
Which gives us 2a=b+5=3+5=8 ewline
and a=$ rac{8}{2}=4$ ewline
extbf{The number is 10a+b=10$ imes$4+3=43}
%-------------------------------------------%%-------------------------------------------%%-------------------------------------------%
egin{itemize}
┬а ┬а \item extbf{9. In the two digit number, the digit in unit place is more than twice the digit in the tenth place by 1 and if the digits in the unit place and the tenth place are interchanged, Difference between the newly formed number and the original number is less than the original number by 1. What is the original Number? ┬а }\emph{[JBL(AEO)-2015]}
\end{itemize}
┬а extbf{Solution: } ewline
┬аAssume that the number is 10A+B. where A is the tenth place and B is the Unit place number respectively. ewline
┬аGiven, ewline
┬а$B=2A+1\dotfill(9.1)$ ewline
┬а$(10B+A)-(10A+B)=(10A+B)-1 ewline
┬аor,9B-9A=10A+B-1 ewline
┬аor,8B-19A=-1 ewline
┬аor,8(2A+1)-19A=-1 ewline
┬аor,16A-19A+8=-1 ewline
┬аor,-3A=-9 ewline
┬аor,A=3 ewline this Implies ewline
┬аB=2A+1=2 imes 3+1=7 $[\emph{USING EQUATION 9.1}] ewline
┬а extbf{The Number is 10$ imes$3 + 7=37}
┬а%-------------------------------------------%%-------------------------------------------%%-------------------------------------------%
┬а egin{itemize}
┬а ┬а ┬а\item extbf{10. If a number of two digits is divided by the product of its digits,The quotient is 3. When 18 is added to the number, the digits of the number change their places. Find the number.}\emph{[SIBL(CASH)-2013]}
┬а\end{itemize}
extbf{Solution:} ewline
Let the number be 10a+b, Where a is at tenth place and b is at unit place. ewline
Given, ewline
$ rac{10a+b}{a imes b}=3 ewline
ewline
(10a+b)=3 imes ab\dotfill (10.1) ewline$
Again, ewline
$(10a+b)+18=10b+a ewline
or,9a-9b=-18 ewline
or,b-a=2 ewline
or, b=2-a\dotfill(10.2) ewline$
Using (10.2) in equation (10.1) we obtain, ewline










┬а
┬а ┬а┬а
\end{document}

items.content_html:
рзирзжрзирзи рж╕рж╛рж▓рзЗрж░ рж╕рж┐рж▓рзЗржмрж╛рж╕ ржЕржирзБржпрж╛рзЯрзА ржПржХрж╛ржжрж╢ ржжрзНржмрж╛ржжрж╢ рж╢рзНрж░рзЗржгрж┐рж░ рж╕ржХрж▓ ржЕржзрзНржпрж╛рзЯрзЗрж░ ржЧрж╛ржгрж┐рждрж┐ржХ рж╕ржорж╕рзНржпрж╛рж░ ржнрж┐ржбрж┐ржУ ржнрж┐рждрзНрждрж┐ржХ рж╕ржорж╛ржзрж╛ржи ржирж┐ржорзНржирзЗ ржкрзНрж░ржжрждрзНржд рж▓рж┐ржВржХ рж╕ржорзВрж╣рзЗ ржжрзЗрзЯрж╛ рж╣рзЯрзЗржЫрзЗред

    • ржорзНржпрж╛ржЯрзНрж░рж┐ржХрзНрж╕
